overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting 96 hours of HULL data, focusing on identifying patterns and constraints. It emphasizes daily seasonality detection, acknowledges data limitations (only 4 days of history), and selects a simple averaging method due to the inability to model weekly seasonality. The approach is pragmatic, prioritizing robustness and simplicity given the small dataset and text-based constraints.
common_data_patterns: Peak loads during certain hours and drops at night
Complete data in the training period (no missing values)
key_insights: Daily seasonality is the primary pattern leveraged for forecasting via hourly averaging
Limited historical data prevents modeling weekly seasonality despite observed weekend variations
Averaging same-hour values across multiple days provides robustness for short-term forecasts
Rounding forecasted values to 3 decimals maintains consistency with input data format
Explicit handling of date-time alignment for forecast period generation
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines data pattern analysis, practical constraints evaluation, and method selection trade-offs, but implements a straightforward averaging solution due to data limitations.
